page.title: 11Recording Studio at Ladock 1
page.content:
Mr. Wood has lived at Trendeal for fifteen months. He has only been recording for two months because he built the recording studio himself. It was once{an old barn on Duchy Land {which Prince Charles converted into a {house and studio as part of a {development scheme.
There are three rooms in the recording studio; one is used for the musicians. This room has a little room in the corner where the drummer goes. There are lots of microphones which go over every drum so you can hear them better. Another room is for Mr. Wood to record in and the third for his synthesisers.
He is building a workshop in the garden as he mends recording machines as well.
